howtoinvestfordummies.model

Interface StockInvestmentStrategies

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InvestmentStrategies
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StockInvestmentStrategiesModel

    public interface StockInvestmentStrategies
extends InvestmentStrategies
    Handles all the operations related to Stock Investment. It extends InvestmentStrategies and for the initial version, it provides support to specialized features related to buying of stocks. Changes/Additions
    • Added a new method to support buying with commission. This method also supports flexibility to add future enhancements in this application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • buySharesOfStock

        void buySharesOfStock(java.util.Date date,
                      double amount,
                      java.lang.String symbol,
                      java.lang.String portfolioName)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        This method allows trading of the stocks which includes certain shares(integer or fraction) for a given amount. Since the entire purpose of this interface is to make user understand about the stock investment, through this method, user can understand buying of stocks at a certain date which could be a past date. Date should also include the time in 24Hr format so that user explores various scenarios which could happen in actual trading (For Example, restricting user to not buying anything after stock exchange operation hours or on holidays.). Implementor is free to choose the strategy for selecting operation hours as per the exchange timings and timezone. If the user does not provide time, current time will be taken into consideration for today's date.

        Note that, user can buy shares for a given portfolio name. The minimum amount required for user to invest should be greater than 0.0. Along with the mentioned data, user must provide company ticker symbol which helps in identifying the stocks that user wants to buy. If any of these parameters are not as expected, the method should throw IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        date - for which user needs to buy stock. It should be in "MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm:ss" format.
        amount - in double which describes total cost of investment of user for this purchase.
        symbol - unique company ticker symbol in String to identify stock of that company.
        portfolioName - name of the Portfolio in String for which user wants to buy stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case parameters provided are incorrect.

      • buyStocksWithCommission

        void buyStocksWithCommission(Transaction transaction)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        This method allows user to buy stocks with different parameters. Transaction object contains data required to buy stocks such as Date, stock symbol, transaction date, portfolio name, etc. Additionally, if user wants to purchase with commission, this can also be set for each transaction call. If user intends to buy stock with basic parameters, please use buySharesOfStock(Date, double, String, String) method for the same.

        Parameters:
        transaction - of type Transaction containing details for buying stocks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case parameters provided are incorrect.
